description: ANCA testing detects and measures the amount of these autoantibodies in the blood. Two of the most common ANCAs are the autoantibodies that target the proteins myeloperoxidase (MPO) and proteinase 3 (PR3). These are called pANCAs (perinuclear staining) and cANCAs (granular cytoplasmic staining), respectively.
name: ANCA Antibodies and Antigens
